page.title: 16Burton Market
page.content: On Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays the Market is held in the town. The Market Place is in the town centre, across the road from the Shopping Centre, and in front of St. Modwen's, the Parish Church. On Market Days the place is filled with little stalls, each with their canvas covers, selling almost anything from buckets to bracelets, from sacks to saucepans. There is a plan to "smarten up" the market, but this is opposed by some stallholders who think that this will threaten the tradition of the market, although many people think that it is about time something was done to improve the rather tatty appearance. As well as the large open market, there is also a covered Market Hall, and a separate but smaller Fish Market.
